conversation.message: Dear School_A admissions team, I’m Student_A and I’m very excited about the opportunity to join School_A. I value a rigorous academic environment and I’m ready to contribute positively to the school community. School_A is one of my top choices, and if admitted I will gladly accept the offer. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but I have the lowest priority there, so an immediate apply is very likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply this round. To maximize my final outcome, I should pursue my next best option where my acceptance chances are higher. At School_C, I am also low priority, but School_A ranks me 3rd, giving me a realistic shot if top-ranked students go elsewhere. Therefore, I will apply to School_A now to secure a strong match early rather than risk ending up much lower.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for your strong interest in School_A. After reviewing applicants in this round and considering our current capacity, we’re not able to extend an offer to you at this time.

We sincerely appreciate your interest and wish you the very best in the remainder of the process.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and received APPLY from Student_A and Student_E. On School_A’s true priority list, Student_E is ranked #1 while Student_A is ranked #3. Since accepting Student_A now would fill the only seat and block matching with the top-priority Student_E (who is also currently applying), the optimal strategy to maximize School_A’s outcome is to reject Student_A and keep the seat available for Student_E.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_E. School_A is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the opportunity to join your community. I’m ready to commit if accepted and would be grateful for your consideration. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C ranks me 4th (behind B, C, D). With capacity 1, applying there immediately is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. In contrast, School_A ranks me 1st overall, so an early [APPLY] should secure a match. Although School_A is my 3rd choice, locking in a guaranteed seat now avoids the risk of ending up at an even lower choice later if I fail at School_C/School_D. Therefore I will apply to School_A to maximize certainty while still landing a relatively high option.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_A.

We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

[ACCEPT]

Although School_A is Student_E’s #3 choice (after School_C and School_D), accepting now secures our top-priority student and avoids the risk that Student_E matches elsewhere in subsequent rounds. Student_A (also applied) is only #3 on our list and was previously rejected; even if we waited, we might lose Student_E to a higher-ranked option. Therefore, accept Student_E immediately.

conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions—I'm Student_B. If admitted, School_C would be one of my top choices and I would commit seriously to succeeding there. Thank you for considering my application.

With capacity 1, my acceptance chance there is low if any of those three apply. School_C, my 3rd choice, ranks me 1st, giving me a strong chance to secure a high-ranked match immediately. To maximize the probability of getting as high as possible on my true list, I will apply to School_C now rather than risk being rejected by School_A and losing time/positions elsewhere.

conversation.message:

conversation.thought: Student_B is #1 on School_C’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and only Student_B applied this round. Even if we might attract Student_C or Student_D later, they are ranked below Student_B, so immediate acceptance is optimal.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_D and School_B is my first choice. I’m very motivated to enroll and would commit immediately if offered a seat. conversation.message: Dear Student_D, thank you for your strong interest in School_B and for applying. Also, Student_E (my top choice) currently ranks School_B last, so unlikely to apply soon; Student_B ranks School_B second and may apply later if not accepted by School_A. Given I can immediately secure Student_C (higher than D) and there is no benefit to accepting D over C, I should reject D.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_C and School_B is my first choice. I’m excited about the opportunity to join your community and would gladly accept an offer if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for applying to School_B and for sharing your strong interest. After reviewing the applications we received this round, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your enthusiasm and wish you the very best in the rest of the matching process.
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A, with quota 1. In this round I received APPLY from Student_C and Student_D. Between them, Student_C ranks higher than Student_D, so if I must choose now, C is preferable. However, my top two (Student_E and Student_B) have not contacted me yet and could plausibly apply later; accepting C now would fill my only seat and prevent matching with E or B. Given the rules, I can only respond ACCEPT/REJECT to an APPLY (no holding). To maximize the chance of matching with a higher-priority student, I should reject Student_C now and remain available for E or B. Student_C has School_B as first choice, so rejecting risks ending unmatched, but my objective is to match as high as possible on my priority list, even if that means risking no match. Therefore, reject C this round.
